alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 2:58PM MDT until July 06 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE TRAIL MOUNTAIN BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL EMERY COUNTY... At 258 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported debris flow and muddy water out of Crandall Canyon that is now moving downstream within Huntington Creek toward the Power Plant. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Huntington Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A debris flow is expected to impact Huntington Creek, spring water supply infrastructure, and potentially the Crandall Canyon Monument. Additionally the water intakes for the Huntington Power Plant just upstream from Huntington, and the Huntington Cleveland Irrigation Company may be impacted. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
